Translations.item: A virtual domain is where multiple domains point to the same computer and server, but based on the domain the user used, you want them to see different results. For example, www.benspink.com and www.crushftp.com both point to my same machine. However I can set www.benspink.com to display something completely different than www.crushftp.com if I choose to.

Multiple domains pointed at this one machine? Make specific login pages styled to fit each domain so your customers get the styled page you want them to see. You may also use this to alter the default login page users will see. Don't use the default "login.html" as its a file CrushFTP owns and will update it with each new release. So make your own file and point the login at it.

A mini URL is a secure URL you can send to clients. It allows an end user to access a specific file, or folder without needing to login. It does not include the username or password as part of the URL. When a user uses the URL, it allows them to be logged in to an account, to retrieve the file specified. You may also set an expiration of when the URL will automatically be deleted and no longer valid.

VFS linking allows you to link other user's virtual file systems into this user. This means when the user logs in, they will see and have access to the other user's virtual file system merged with their own. You can use this to have a \"master\" user with some default folders you want every user to have access to, but still make every user have their own individual VFS items as well.

This allows you to link this user to other users. So you make a change to one user, and all users who are linked to them will reflect the changes. You can link to multiple users in which case it builds the overall customizations / buttons from each user in the order that they were linked. Inheritance trails will not be followed however if you specify a user who also is linking to another user.

To create a new schedule, first configure a report in the setup tab. It would be a good idea to run the report as well and make sure its returning the information you want.
Then come back to this tab, and click 'Create New Schedule'. This will take a snapshot of the current report setup. Then you can configure the settings for the scheduled report on the right.

You may set a default logo file to be used. This file will be used as the default unless you override it with a custom setting on a per user basis. This includes the logo that is displayed for the login page.

Its important to set this here as just replacing the logo.gif file will get overwritten the next time you update. Your logo file must be in the WebInterface/images/ directory for it to work. Enter the name of your logo file below. The default is 'logo.gif', but you should use a different name to prevent your logo from being overwritten.

Please note! It appears that this event is not properly configured. Most events will have a '<LINE>text and %variables%</LINE>' entry in the email body. This event does not. This may be intentional, but if not, please see the 'Variables / Templates' drop down menu above. It has you examples on how to setup an event.

Migrating All Users (for advanced users only)
This allows you to do a batch update of all users who were pointed at one hard drive for their data folders to be pointed to another location. This is essentially a string replace on the path as defined in the user's VFS on the right side of the user manager. You will be asked for the old location, and then asked for the new location. For example, if you moved from a hard drive named 'iMacG3' to a new machine with the hard drive named 'IntelMacPro', you could update all paths in one quick process. Example:
You would enter '/Volumes/iMacG3/' in the migrating 'from' location, and enter '/Volumes/IntelMacPro/' in the migrating 'to' location.
CrushFTP will scan through all users, and update each VFS item to point to the new location. It will do a replace if the 'from' location starts with the old location, and will make it start with the new value.

CrushFTP remote admin needs a place to store temporary files. These files will be deleted when you close the admin session window. Please choose a location where this temporary folder will be created.

You have the CrushFTP service installed. When you click Yes, the service will be restarted. This must be done to finish the update. Any users who are connected will be disconnected.
If you click No, you will need to either restart your computer, or remove the bootup service and reinstall it.
